isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - PROGRAMMING

svcsubsecinfo.para: The electronic speedometer/tachometer unit has (2) sets of (10) DIP switches located on the top side of the housing ( Figure 32). One set of switches is labeled SPEEDOMETER and the other is labeled TACHOMETER.

important.para: The Speedometer And Tachometer Switches Must Be Programmed (Dip Switches Set To Either "1" Or "0") Whenever The Speedometer/Tachometer Unit Housing Is Replaced Or The Tire Size, Axle Ratio Or Engine Is Changed.

REPLACING THE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER UNIT - The Replacement Speedometer/Tachometer Unit Must Be Programmed To The Same Binary Code As The Unit Being Replaced. Note The Dip Switch Positions On The Unit Being Replaced And Set The Switches On The Replacement Panel In The Same Positions.

TIRE SIZE OR AXLE RATIO CHANGES - The speedometer switches in the speedometer/tachometer unit must be reprogrammed whenever the vehicle drive axle(s) tire size or drive axle ratio is changed. Refer to
SPEEDOMETER in this section for information to calculate necessary changes in DIP switch settings.

ENGINE CHANGE - If the engine is replaced with an engine with a different number of teeth on the flywheel refer to
TACHOMETER in this section for information necessary to change the DIP switch settings.
